# distances

**Instance Property**

The system of measurement that displays on the map.

## Declaration

```swift
get distances(): Distance;
set distances(distances: Distance);
```

## Discussion

Sets the system of measurement for displaying map distances. See [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Distance] for accepted values.

This property applies to the scale, if it displays. The default value is [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Distance/Adaptive], which means that the measurement system depends on the map’s set [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MapKitInitializationOptions/language]. This property affects displayed distances only; it doesn’t affect data that returns from a service, such as [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Directions].

## Distances

- **Distance**: Constants indicating the system of measurement that displays on the map.

## Configuring the map’s appearance

- **colorScheme**: The map’s color scheme when displaying standard or muted standard map types.
- **ColorScheme**: Constants that indicate the color scheme of the map or a place detail.
- **Distance**: Constants indicating the system of measurement that displays on the map.
- **mapType**: The type of data that the map displays.
- **MapType**: Constants representing the type of map to display.
- **padding**: The map’s inset margins.
- **pointOfInterestFilter**: The filter that determines the points of interest that display on the map.
- **showsPointsOfInterest**: A Boolean value that determines whether the map displays points of interest.
- **showItems(items, options)**: Adjusts the map’s visible region to bring the specified overlays and annotations into view.
- **MapShowItemsOptions**: Options that determine the map parameters to use when showing items.
- **tintColor**: The CSS color that MapKit JS uses for user interface controls on the map.
